channel.title: Dankwart A. Rustow on

item.title: The Euro-American System: Economic and Political Relations Between North America and Western Europe - Interdependence in the International Monetary System
item.description: Book Chapter: Explicitly linking back to (1967a) Strange examines the contemporary political economy of international debt, but also seeks to put this situation into a longer historical context than merely the previous ten years. Suggesting that states can choose to grow by direction (the socialist route) or via debt, she argues that recently the combination of the welfare state and more complex credit system has allowed many states to reduce the debt risk they explicitly face and therefore expand through the extensive use of credit.
